metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1665 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The JSGenericLowering class in compiler/js-generic-lowering.cc in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 50.0.2661.94, mishandles comparison operators, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via crafted JavaScript code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu1.1242').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
